headline: Vaccine makers feel a chill as US Health Secretary Kennedy's rhetoric becomes reality
summary: The unprecedented changes have led to diminished vaccine usage, hurt the investment case for some biotechs, and created a ‌drag that will likely dent revenues and raise costs for companies in the coming years, 15 investors and analysts told Reuters.

content.title: Vaccine makers feel a chill as US Health Secretary Kennedy's rhetoric becomes reality
content.summary: The unprecedented changes have led to diminished vaccine usage, hurt the investment case for some biotechs, and created a ‌drag that will likely dent revenues and raise costs for companies in the coming years, 15 investors and analysts told Reuters.

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Greenland Tensions Thaw
summary: Hopes for a Greenland agreement lifted markets.  President Trump said he wouldn't impose tariffs on several European nations after reaching the "framework of a future deal."  The Supreme Court heard arguments on the Federal Reserve governor case.

content.title: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Greenland Tensions Thaw
content.summary: Hopes for a Greenland agreement lifted markets.  President Trump said he wouldn't impose tariffs on several European nations after reaching the "framework of a future deal."  The Supreme Court heard arguments on the Federal Reserve governor case.

headline: Moderna CEO Says Vaccine Scrutiny Curbing Trials
summary: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel says the company does not plan to invest in late-stage vaccine trials because of growing scrutiny of immunizations from US officials. He speaks with Lisa Abramowicz at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

content.title: Moderna CEO Says Vaccine Scrutiny Curbing Trials
content.description: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel says the company does not plan to invest in late-stage vaccine trials because of growing scrutiny of immunizations from US officials. He speaks with Lisa Abramowicz at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.
content.summary: Moderna CEO Stephane Bancel says the company does not plan to invest in late-stage vaccine trials because of growing scrutiny of immunizations from US officials. He speaks with Lisa Abramowicz at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

headline: MRNA & MRK's Personalized Cancer Therapy Delivers Strong 5-Year Data
summary: Moderna rises after five-year phase IIb data show the combo of intismeran autogene plus Keytruda cuts recurrence or death risk by 49% in high-risk melanoma.

content.title: MRNA & MRK's Personalized Cancer Therapy Delivers Strong 5-Year Data
content.summary: Moderna rises after five-year phase IIb data show the combo of intismeran autogene plus Keytruda cuts recurrence or death risk by 49% in high-risk melanoma.

headline: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq rise, mortgage rates tick higher
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, Jan 22. All three of the major indexes are rising as President Trump cools his rhetoric on Greenland. Mortgage rates ticked higher, with the average 30-year mortgage rate at 6.09% through Wednesday, according to Freddie Mac data, up from 6.06% a week earlier. Moderna (MRNA) shares continue to rise on promising results from a cancer vaccine study. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq rise, mortgage rates tick higher
content.description:
Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, Jan 22.

All three of the major indexes are rising as President Trump cools his rhetoric on Greenland.

Mortgage rates ticked higher, with the average 30-year mortgage rate at 6.09% through Wednesday, according to Freddie Mac data, up from 6.06% a week earlier.

Moderna (MRNA) shares continue to rise on promising results from a cancer vaccine study.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
content.summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, Jan 22. All three of the major indexes are rising as President Trump cools his rhetoric on Greenland. Mortgage rates ticked higher, with the average 30-year mortgage rate at 6.09% through Wednesday, according to Freddie Mac data, up from 6.06% a week earlier. Moderna (MRNA) shares continue to rise on promising results from a cancer vaccine study. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
